author: Deleted User
content: How would the overlay of binary tree over hexary tree works in practice? I understand there is a snapshot of the state (similar to the flat layout of turbo-geth). Then there is some extra info in the DB about binary tree nodes?

author: gballet
content:
You make the hexary tree read-only and start its conversion in the background, while all updates are being stored somewhere else in order not to disrupt conversion by forcing it to restart. So for a time, you have two layers of tree, much like what docker does with with file system trees, each layer stacked on top of the next.
So in practice, you have two storage spaces, which can use whatever layout the client is comfortable with, even if I like the  (Key,Value) store idea best. The hope is that the top layer should not grow too fast, and can therefore be re-inserted quickly when the conversion of the base layer form hex to binary is over.
